item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Harry S. Truman
item.description:
"Once a government is committed to the principle of silencing the voice of opposition, it has only one way to go, and that is down the path of increasingly repressive measures, until it becomes a source of terror to all its citizens and creates a country where everyone lives in fear."
[<i>Special Message to the Congress on the Internal Security of the United States</i>, August 8, 1950]" -- Harry S. Truman

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Louisiana in September was like an obscene phone call from nature. The air - moist, sultry, secretive, and far from fresh - felt as if it were being exhaled into one's face. Sometimes it even sounded like heavy breathing." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends." -- George Bernard Shaw
